Package HW2

Class ConnectFourGame

java.lang.Object
HW2.ConnectFourGame
public class ConnectFourGame
extends java.lang.Object
The ConnectFourGame class represents a game of connect four - including the board and game state. This class is typically used to simplify the creation of 2-player connect four client.

To create a Connect Four Game (an instance of this class) it's as simple as 

 ConnectFourGame game = new ConnectFourGame();
When instantiated, the state of the game is GameState.IN_PROGRESS and a random GamePlayer A or B is selected to make the first move. The state of the game can be checked with game.state() and the player whose turn it is with game.playerToMove().

To get started, a typical client will write code like: 

        // create an instance of the game
        ConnectFourGame game = new ConnectFourGame();
        // keep asking user for moves while the game hasn't ended
        while (game.state() == GameState.IN_PROGRESS) {
            // read input from stdin
            Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
            System.out.print("Select a column: ");
            int colForPlayer = scanner.nextInt() - 1;
            // check if the move is valid
            if (game.isValidMove(game.playerToMove(), colForPlayer)) {
                // make the move
                game.makeMove(game.playerToMove(), colForPlayer);
            }
        }
        // GameState is now GameState.OVER
        switch (game.winner()) {
            // case on GameWinner.A, GameWinner.B, GameWinner.DRAW
        }

This class in not thread safe.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int BOARD_COLS
    A constant (7) indicating the number of columns for a Connect Four board.
    static int BOARD_ROWS
    A constant (6) indicating the number of rows for a Connect Four board.

  • Field Details

    • BOARD_ROWS

      public static final int BOARD_ROWS
      A constant (6) indicating the number of rows for a Connect Four board.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • BOARD_COLS

      public static final int BOARD_COLS
      A constant (7) indicating the number of columns for a Connect Four board.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • ConnectFourGame

      public ConnectFourGame()
      Creates a ConnectFourGame. The board is initially empty, and the game.playerToMove() is random. The class is simply instantiated 
       ConnectFourGame game = new ConnectFourGame();

  • Method Details

    • winner

      public GameWinner winner()
      Returns the winner of the Connect Four Game if the game is over, otherwise it returns GameWinner.NONE. If the game resulted in a draw, the function returns GameWinner.DRAW. The game is over if game.state() == GameState.OVER.
      Returns:
      The winner of the Connect Four Game, DRAW, or NONE depending on the state of the game.

    • state

      public GameState state()
      Returns if the game is IN_PROGRESS or OVER. If the game in OVER, then the value of game.winner() will be A, B, or DRAW. If the game is IN_PROGRESS, the value of game.winner() will be NONE.
      Returns:
      if the game is GameState.IN_PROGRESS or GameState.OVER.

    • playerToMove

      public GamePlayer playerToMove()
      Returns the player who makes the next move. At the beginning of the game the player is chosen randomly. Afterwards it changes between player A and B. If game.playerToMove() return A, then after a successful move is made, game.playerToMove() will return B. And vice-versa.
      Returns:
      The player to make the next move.

    • getSquare

      public GamePiece getSquare​(int row, int col) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the GamePiece of the Connect Four Board at the given row and column. The board is 0 indexed and has 6 rows and 7 columns. This function will return A, B, or NONE based on if Player A, Player B, or no player has placed a piece at the position in the board - respectively.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the board piece you want to query.
      col - the column of the board piece you want to query.
      Returns:
      The GamePiece at the specified (row, col) in the Connect Four Board.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - throws if row, col < 0 or row >= BOARD_ROWS or col >= BOARD_COLS.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove​(GamePlayer player, int column)
      Returns true if player can legally place a piece in column. The player must be the game.playerToMove() and the column must be in the board, and not full.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to make the move
      column - the column to place the piece in
      Returns:
      true if the player can legally place a piece in the column, and false otherwise.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove​(GamePlayer player, int column) throws InvalidMoveExcpetion
      Updates the ConnectFourGame with the move by player placing a piece in column. A piece is added to the board by the player in the column specified. If this results in four in a row or full board, the game.state() becomes OVER and the winner (or draw state) can be found in game.winner(). Finally, the game.playerToMove() switches to the other player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to make the move.
      column - The column to add the piece to.
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveExcpetion - Thrown if isValidMove(player, column) is false.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Connect Four Game's board. Empty squres are indicated by an x Player A's piece are indicated by an a, and Player B's pieces are indictaed by a b.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the Connect Four Game's board.
